image.altText: Collage of three masked faces, one with a balaclava, another with a wrestling mask. They are cut by three lines of cocaine.

items.synopsis: Australians are the biggest consumers of cocaine in the world, and we pay top dollar for it. For the first time, three dealers lift the lid on this booming industry.

title.children: 'I've seen judges take it with a glass of single malt': Australia's cocaine dealers tell all

image.altText: Woman with dark curly shoulder length hair and light brown skin sits in front of a laptop in an office late at night

items.synopsis: Many Australians work very long hours, compared to other similar nations. This can lead to a poor work-life balance and a constant feeling of being time poor.

title.children: 'I was the most anxious I have ever been in my life': The mental and physical toll of long working hours

image.altText: A woman holds an iPhone in her left hand showing the Afterpay name and logo.

items.synopsis: Buy now, pay later services, including Afterpay and Zip Pay, will be regulated under the Credit Act and required to obtain an Australian Credit Licence under proposed changes by the federal government.

title.children: Buy now, pay later industry to be regulated under Credit Act after changes by federal government

image.altText: Aqua-coloured graphic image depicting a woman with short hair surrounded by psychadelic imagery and mushrooms

items.synopsis: Doctors told Lindy Bok she had two years to live. The psychedelic compound found in "magic mushrooms" is helping her face death, and get "20 years of therapy in one hit".

title.children: Lindy has a terminal illness. This is what made her laugh again

image.altText: a woman wearing glasses sitting down and holding an ipad showing a picture of an elderly woman

items.synopsis: After dementia sufferer Rachel Grahame was handcuffed by police at an aged care centre in Sydney's east in 2020, her daughter wants authorities to be more accountable after the latest incident in Cooma.

title.children: Family of elderly woman handcuffed by police in nursing home speaks out

image.altText: 5 people on a dark background. There are five circles below them: green, grey, orange, yellow and red

items.synopsis: Use the ABC's Promise Tracker to check in on the government's progress over its first year.

title.children: A year after the Albanese government was elected, how is it going at keeping its promises?

image.altText: Aerial view shows destroyed multi-storey building with fire and smoke seen on some floors.

items.synopsis: Ukraine says its forces are still advancing around the edges of Bakhmut, aiming to encircle the ruined city, after Moscow congratulated the Wagner private army and Russian troops for capturing it.

title.children: Ukrainian troops aiming to encircle Bakhmut as Russia claims the ruined city

image.altText: Vinu, Akila and their two children taking a selfie.

items.synopsis: Last year, the ABC issued a call-out asking readers to share their stories about how they were coping with rising interest rates and prices for everyday goods and services. Here's what some of them say they are doing now, nearly 12 months later, to make ends meet.

title.children: 'All I could do was cry': Australians reveal how they're dealing with the cost-of-living crisis

image.altText: A sign showing India's Prime Minster (right) and a photo sign of PNG's PM (left).

items.synopsis: India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi lands in Port Moresby to host the third Forum for India-Pacific Islands Cooperation (FIPIC), which brings together leaders and top officials from New Delhi and 14 Pacific Island nations.

title.children: India's Modi lands in Papua New Guinea to host senior leaders at forum for India-Pacific Islands cooperation

image.altText: a woman and a man holding a baby stand next to each other smiling on a beach, they are each holding a beer bottle

items.synopsis: The bodies of 26-year-old Jane Strong and 22-year-old Eli Johnson were found inside the burnt-out caravan. Ms Strong's partner was also injured in the blaze.

title.children: Community in shock after fatal caravan fire on rural southern Queensland property

image.altText: A young brown girl is adorned with gold, beaded jewellery and colourful sari. She is smiling confidently.

items.synopsis: From wanting to speak in an Aussie accent to comparing herself to others around her, Prarthana has learnt how to feel confident in her own skin.

title.children: 'My brown skin is beautiful': Prarthana's message for young girls trying to fit in

image.altText: A woman holds her palm to her forehead as she stands in a corridor, silhouetted.

items.synopsis: A new survey has revealed that 45 per cent of 1,000 employees surveyed have felt overwhelmed by debt.

title.children: Mental wellbeing falls to levels last seen during COVID-19 lockdowns as cost-of-living pressure grows

image.altText: Joe Biden putting an arm around Volodymyr Zelenskyy

items.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy insists the city of Bakhmut is not occupied by Russian forces. It comes after he secures a pledge of further military aid from the US on the sidelines of the G7.

title.children: Zelenskyy denies Russia's claim it has won the bloodiest and longest battle of the Ukraine war so far

image.altText: G7 leaders line up for photo call by the seaside, with a Japanese mon (gate) seen in the water behind.

items.synopsis: The US president says the G7 nations have agreed a united approach to China that calls for diversifying supply chains and hinted he could speak with China's president soon.

title.children: G7 nations agree on united approach to China as Joe Biden aims for meeting with Xi Jinping

image.altText: A Tesla parked next to a dark Volvo SUV near a green space.

items.synopsis: The council says electric vehicles need to be adopted rapidly, but other measures must be taken to cut down transport emissions.

title.children: Australia's private vehicle usage needs to be cut in half to slash emissions, Climate Council says

image.altText: Team Ineos leads the peloton in the rain

items.synopsis: Torrential rain, freezing temperatures and a COVID-19 outbreak have turned this year's Giro d'Italia into a survival of the fittest. But 99 years ago, things were so much worse, with just eight finishers of the most brutal race in history..

title.children: This year's Giro has been attritional, but one year just eight riders finished

image.altText: A 25-year-old woman with brown shoulder-length hair, large earring and formal clothes, sitting in a restaurant

items.synopsis: In her second feature, Petrol, Alena Lodkina delivers an original and uniquely Australian take on universal themes, proving why she is one of most promising young directors.

title.children: This powerful film captures how some friendships can change you and others will nearly destroy you

image.altText: Tara Norris of Delhi Capitals claps in the air and smiles after taking a wicket.

items.synopsis: Tara Norris stunned the cricket world by taking five wickets in an innings in the inaugural WPL. Now the little-known American is making a name for herself in women's cricket.

title.children: This American cricketer is making big waves internationally, and hopes to elevate the game at home

image.altText: Stan Grant David Anderson

items.synopsis: ABC managing director David Anderson apologises to Stan Grant and commits to a review into the ABC's response to racism affecting staff.

title.children: ABC's managing director apologises to Stan Grant after Q+A host steps away from role

image.altText: Jodie Haydon, Anthony Albanese and his son Nathan Albanese on election night.

items.synopsis: Over the past 12 months, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese and his government have put in place many of their key election promises, signed historic defence deals and re-engaged with China, but the year hasn't been without its curve balls either.

title.children: It's been a year since Labor won the election — here's what it's done and what lies ahead

image.altText: a long line of police cars parked on a suburban street

items.synopsis: A 29-year-old First Nations man has been shot dead by police in Brisbane after allegedly stabbing his father and lunging at officers with a knife.

title.children: Man shot dead by police after reports of stabbing in suburban Brisbane

items.synopsis: Kathleen Folbigg was found guilty of killing her four children 20 years ago today. An inquiry will soon decide whether the woman dubbed as "Australia's most hated woman" at the time was wrongly convicted.

title.children: Inside the fight to free Australia's worst female serial killer, Kathleen Folbigg

image.altText: A middle-aged white man with grey hair and glasses wearing a suit speaks in a public place with a cityscape behind him.

items.synopsis: The leaders of the worlds' most advanced economies issued a joint statement late yesterday, calling out China's economic coercion of other countries and stating they remained "seriously concerned about the situation in the East and South China Seas".

title.children: PM backs G7 leaders' calls for China to curb ambition in Indo Pacific region

image.altText: A doctor wearing a white shirt and tie consults patients over his dark timber desk

items.synopsis: For two decades Jindera has had the same GP – an "unusual" former lawyer who just wants to "do some good" for a small country town undergoing rapid change.

title.children: As rural Australia's doctor shortage bites, an 'unusual' GP in Jindera is in town for the long haul

items.synopsis: This is the story behind the drink that started wars and shaped the modern world.

title.children: How a Chinese 'mistake' changed history and shaped the modern world

image.altText: Wagner Group military company members wave a Russian national and Wagner flag atop a damaged building in Bakhmut.

items.synopsis: Russia claims to have fully captured the smashed eastern Ukrainian city of Bakhmut, which if true would mark an end to the longest and bloodiest battle of the 15-month war.

title.children: Russia claims it has captured the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut

image.altText: A man in a white forensic hazmat suit pulls up police tape so he can pass thruogh

items.synopsis: A religious community followed a taxi driver-turned-televangelist into the forests of eastern Kenya. Just weeks later, they turned into a starvation cult. WARNING: Readers might find the details in this story distressing.

title.children: While his followers starved to death, this alleged cult leader continued to live a 'lavish life'. Then police arrived

image.altText: Rescuers attend an injured fan lying on the field of the Cuscatlan stadium in San Salvador, El Salvador.

items.synopsis: An official from the Rescue Commandos first aid group says more than 500 people were treated, with more than 100 taken to hospital.

title.children: 'Avalanche of fans': At least 12 dead after stampede at El Salvador soccer stadium

image.altText: A woman in a violet shirt and pants applies makeup to a woman sitting down.

items.synopsis: More Australians than ever before are working multiple jobs, but despite concerns over burn out, for some people it has become their driving force.

title.children: These Australians are turning their passions into lucrative side hustles as cost pressures bite

image.altText: Brendan Chapman and Ruby Dixon wearing white lab coats in a portrait taken inside a Murdoch lab

items.synopsis: Ruby Dixon says it's the pervasiveness of sexual assault that drives her to find new ways of gathering evidence to hold perpetrators accountable.

title.children: Forensic science discovery suggests bacteria could help convict sex offenders without DNA

image.altText: A bright meteor falls from a starry sky. The image is captured on a grainy black and white camera.

items.synopsis: It's estimated the meteor was between half a metre to a metre in size and would have been travelling within 100,000 to 150,000 kilometres per hour.

title.children: 'The sky lit up — first white, then green': Astrophysicist confirms meteor sightings in Queensland

image.altText: A yacht's sail billows in the wind

items.synopsis: When Kitty O'Sullivan complained about a lewd boat name at Mornington Yacht Club, the owner was given two weeks to change it. But then the club reversed its decision.

title.children: Woman takes on yacht club over backdown on 'misogynistic' boat name ban

image.altText: A woman standing in a kitchen in Broome, May 2023

items.synopsis: Parents in this remote region in WA face wait times of up to two years for childcare, due to a shortage of qualified staff that's having a huge impact on the community.

title.children: Tara had to quit her job due to a childcare shortage in her town. She's just one of many

image.altText: a composite image of the outside of a nursing home and an elderly woman

items.synopsis: The family of 95-year-old taser victim, Clare Nowland, maintain a bedside vigil as questions are raised about why NSW Police police were called to her nursing home.

title.children: Aged care expert says police are called to homes more often than the commissioner may realise

image.altText: A St Kilda AFL forward looks at his excited teammate as they celebrate a goal.

items.synopsis: GWS pushes St Kilda all the way, but the Saints get a vital four points to consolidate their spot in the eight, after the Magpies roll on with a win over rivals Carlton and the Hawks smash the Eagles in Launceston.

title.children: Max King kicks four in Saints win over GWS, Magpies beat Blues by 28, Hawks smash Eagles by 116
